metadata.action_name: Fintech and Artificial Intelligence in Finance - Towards a transparent financial industry (FinAI)

summary.main_objective: Establish a large and interconnected community across academia, public institutions and industry focusing on Financial Technology and Artificial Intelligence, improving transparency in financial services.
key_achievements: Built network of 420+ interdisciplinary researchers from 55 countries
39 European COST countries participated (second largest COST Action)

mou_objectives.title: Blended ML Approaches for FinTech Evaluation
mou_objectives.description: Develop blended approaches to evaluate innovative financial services and their providers, especially in the FinTech domain, building on Machine Learning methods, focussing on prediction of operational fragility, fraudulent and illegal behaviour.
types: 1.e Development of knowledge needing international coordination
mou_objectives.proof: Partnerships with iFactor (Romania), ING Group (Netherlands), Swiss Fintech companies. SNSF research project on Anomaly and Fraud Detection in Blockchain networks.

mou_objectives.title: Interdisciplinary Research Community
mou_objectives.description: Bringing technological, quantitative and economic researchers together, to tackle future research that can only be done in an interdisciplinary setting, and getting actively involved in the blockchain and FinTech communities across Europe.
mou_objectives.proof: Network of 420+ researchers from 49 countries globally, 39 European COST countries. Cooperation with 20+ Fintech associations across Europe. 2000+ members in meetup group.

mou_objectives.title: Knowledge Exchange Platform
mou_objectives.description: Bridging the gap between practitioners from the finance industry, academics and regulators by setting up a common knowledge exchange platform.
mou_objectives.proof: 150+ research events with 6000+ participants from academia, industry, and regulatory sectors. Platforms: quantlet.com, quantinar.com, Blockchain research centre (HU Berlin).

mou_objectives.title: Knowledge Transfer
mou_objectives.description: Transfer knowledge in terms of expertise, scientific tools and human resources across the different disciplines and between academia and industry.
mou_objectives.proof: 150+ research events in interdisciplinary settings. Knowledge platforms with thousands of reproducible research pieces. Strong academia-industry partnerships.

mou_objectives.title: Inclusive ML/AI Community
mou_objectives.description: Establish an inclusive community of researchers on methodological and technological themes in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, to promote Early Career Investigators and increase their visibility.
types: 2.b Building a community around new field
mou_objectives.proof: 20+ PhD theses completed, 10+ professorships promotions. ECIs prioritized for all funding activities. Strong support networks between ECIs and experienced colleagues.

mou_objectives.title: Geographic and Demographic Diversity
mou_objectives.description: Overcome the siloing of research topics by country and achieve geographical and demographical diversity, with special attention to COST Inclusiveness Target countries.
mou_objectives.proof: 246 members from 49 countries, 22 ITC countries. 53% of members from ITC. Young researchers represent 41.3% of all members. Diversity team with dedicated guidelines.

mou_objectives.title: Conceptual Tools for Transparency
mou_objectives.description: Develop a set of conceptual tools for the analysis and communication of black-box models with the aim to make AI models more transparent and comprehensible.
mou_objectives.proof: explainableaiforfinance.com platform. Multiple publications on XAI in finance. Research seminars on XAI Tools in Model Selection.

mou_objectives.title: Regulatory and Practitioner Input
mou_objectives.description: Provide input from practitioners and regulators on transparency and AI in financial services.
mou_objectives.proof: Engagement with regulators through conferences and workshops. Position papers for regulators and policy-makers. CEDPO AI Working Group participation.

deliverables.title: ICO Database
deliverables.description: A database containing pre-ICO documentation and post-ICO performance (ROI and lifespan)

deliverables.title: Crowdfunding/P2P Database
deliverables.description: Database containing data on crowdfunding/P2P platform features useful for rating platform integrity and fraud prediction

deliverables.title: ICO Evaluation Discussion Papers
deliverables.description: Discussion papers on methodology for evaluating/rating ICOs and crowdfunding/P2P platforms and fraud detection with AI tools

deliverables.title: Digital Assets Position Paper
deliverables.description: Position paper and roadmap on mitigating risks connected with increased use of digital assets

deliverables.title: Back-testing Framework Paper
deliverables.description: Discussion paper for possible approaches to building a statistically valid back-testing framework

deliverables.title: AI/ML Stress Testing Paper
deliverables.description: Methodological discussion paper on stress test design for AI and ML models under shifting financial conditions

deliverables.title: AI Testing Position Papers
deliverables.description: Position papers aimed at regulators and policy-makers on methodology for testing AI techniques in real-time

deliverables.title: Transparency Best Practices
deliverables.description: Report on good examples and best practices for a transparent finance industry with guidelines

deliverables.title: Financial Time Series Database
deliverables.description: Internal database of collected financial time series from exchanges and regional platforms

deliverables.title: AI Models Discussion Papers
deliverables.description: Methodological discussion papers on AI models for investment product analysis and network data analysis

deliverables.title: Annual Reports
deliverables.description: Four annual reports for lay audience distributed via local and national media

platforms.name: quantlet.com
platforms.description: Platform housing thousands of code pieces showcasing academic research, making it reproducible for everyone.

platforms.name: quantinar.com
platforms.description: Knowledge, training, and dissemination outlet showcasing fundamentals and cutting-edge research in FinTech and AI in Finance.

platforms.name: explainableaiforfinance.com
platforms.description: Platform dedicated to explainable AI in finance, providing resources and research on transparent AI models.

platforms.name: Blockchain Research Centre
platforms.description: Platform at HU Berlin providing substantial datasets for blockchain and finance research.

platforms.name: FinAI Meetup
platforms.description: Community platform with 2000+ members globally for networking and knowledge sharing.

scientific: Established largest European research network on Fintech and AI in Finance
Built open-source tools for anomaly detection and portfolio optimization
economic: Secured funding from multiple national agencies (SNSF, DFG, Innosuisse, Czech Science Foundation)
Industry partnerships with ING Group, iFactor, OTP Bank
Fintech company collaborations across Switzerland, Romania, Hungary
Revenue potential through commercial applications of research
societal: Career advancement for Early Career Investigators
Educational contributions to EIT Digital Master Schools
Established research centers (Financial Market and Corporate Outcomes at Rennes)
Gender diversity initiatives with dedicated diversity team

emerging_topics: AI and Machine Learning optimization in financial institutions
Blockchain technology in finance (digital currencies, smart contracts, DeFi)
Privacy and data protection in financial AI

key_partnerships.name: iFactor
key_partnerships.focus: AI tools for financial risk assessment
